SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc12
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Controller.Server

Class ServerController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Controller.Server.ServerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerInterface, ServerControllerInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConnectionController, GameController, LobbyController
public abstract class ServerController extends Object implements ServerControllerInterface
The ServerController class is an abstract base class that implements the ServerControllerInterface and provides common functionality for various types of server controllers in the application.

This class manages network sessions and handles operations such as player management, keep-alive routines, and command execution. Unimplemented method calls on the wrong controller will fall back to this class's implementations.

Existing controller implementations include:

  • ConnectionController
  • LobbyController
  • GameController

    • MODEL

      public static final ServerModel MODEL
      The model representing the server's state.

    • INACTIVE_SESSIONS

      public static final ConcurrentHashMap<String,NetworkSession> INACTIVE_SESSIONS
      A map of inactive network sessions. Assumes the nickname of a player is unique.

    • ACTIVE_PLAYERS

      protected static final Map<NetworkSession,Player> ACTIVE_PLAYERS
      A map of active players associated with their network sessions.

      protected static final ReentrantReadWriteLock ACTIVE_PLAYERS_LOCK
      A lock for synchronizing access to the active players map.

    • putActivePlayer

      public void putActivePlayer(NetworkSession session, Player player)
      Adds a player to the active players map. This method is thread-safe.
      Parameters:
      session - the network session associated with the player
      player - the player to be added

    • getSessionFromActivePlayer

      public NetworkSession getSessionFromActivePlayer(Player player)
      Retrieves the network session associated with a given player. This method is thread-safe.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose session is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the network session associated with the player

    • removeActivePlayer

      protected void removeActivePlayer(NetworkSession session)
      Removes a player from the active players map. This method is thread-safe.
      Parameters:
      session - the network session associated with the player

    • hasNoPlayer

      protected boolean hasNoPlayer(NetworkSession client)
      Checks if a client has no associated player. This can happen due to malicious interaction or connection errors.
      Parameters:
      client - the network session of the client
      Returns:
      true if the client has no associated player, false otherwise

    • renewTimeoutTimerTask

      public void renewTimeoutTimerTask(NetworkSession target)
      Renews the timeout timer task for a network session, scheduling it for execution after some time or when a certain condition is satisfied.
      Parameters:
      target - the network session to renew the timeout task for

    • createTimeoutTask

      protected TimerTask createTimeoutTask(NetworkSession target)
      Creates a timeout task for a network session. The run method handles disconnections and ensures the thread doesn't execute further.
      Parameters:
      target - the network session to create the timeout task for
      Returns:
      the created timeout task

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      sender - the network session sending the keep-alive command

      nickname - the player's nickname
